text: Hi, i start a peer  as 'peer node start' but i am getting error as 08:55:12.824 [peer] chatWithPeer -> ERRO 02d Error creating connection to peer address 172.17.0.2:7051: grpc: timed out when dialing
how to solve it
<@U2L125QGL>  you need to connect the peer on correct ip/port. please verify ip and port of peer to which you are trying to connect
help me how to check ip and port of peer
if u start one peer  i  think no need of giving any ip or port right?
yes if you starting single peer there is no need to give ip
are you using docker-compose or using CLI ?
i am using CLI
which commands you are using ?
peer node start
peer node start --peer-chaincodedev
try this

Hi all, is there some sort of yearly event/conference for Hyperledger, or that Hyperledger is a part of?
<@U3187PKT2|5erj> has joined the channel

Hi guys, I'm running into problems when trying the `peer chaincode` commands as specified in the documentation at: <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Chaincode-setup/#running-the-cli-or-rest-api>  when using the Vagrant setup (option 1), so I was wondering if there are currently any known issues with that setup?
specifically `peer chaincode deploy` seems to require a path parameter `-p` to successfully run.

and `peer chaincode invoke` is throwing the following error:
```
Error: Error endorsing chaincode: rpc error: code = 2 desc = Error deploying chaincode: Failed to launch chaincode spec(Could not get deployment transaction from LCCC for mycc - Error deploying chaincode: Transaction or query returned with failure: transaction not found default/mycc)
```
(note: running peer in dev mode with security not enabled)
<@U3187PKT2> are you running in master ?
<@U0ULK2JPP> Running in master.
<@U3187PKT2> can you paste the deploy command you are using
<@U0ULK2JPP> `vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.1-7e7e23c:/hyperledger/examples/chaincode/go/chaincode_example02$ peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -p . -c '{"Args": ["init", "a","100", "b", "200"]}'`
I had to include the `-p` param because the command was requiring it.
here's what I see on the running chaincode output:
<@U3187PKT2|5erj> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/5erj/F31RU16TS/-.txt|Untitled>

text: can you try `CORE_CHAINCODE_MODE=dev peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c '{"Args": ["init", "a","100", "b", "200"]}’`
should I restart the peer and chaincode first?
yes
yep, that went through. So do I have to start the peer, chaincode and run the commands in the same shell session?
(assuming that starting the peer in dev mode sets that variable already in the shell)
The `invoke` still throws the same error though.
are you running the orderer ?
nope

<@U0ULK2JPP|muralisr> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/muralisr/F31SUN4P3/simple_test_with_skeletal_peer.md|simple_test_with_skeletal_peer.md> and commented: I really suggest you use 0.6 while the master is being worked upon.. but the above should help you try out the limited capabilities

# V1.0 Skeletal Environment
The V1.0 work is on its way (please see https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-37 for details).

The approach being taken is to have a skeletal implementation in with minimal component hookups to enable

initial_comment.comment: I really suggest you use 0.6 while the master is being worked upon.. but the above should help you try out the limited capabilities

text: you don’t need `CORE_CHAINCODE_MODE=dev` in 0.6 in `peer chaincode deploy ….`
ok, thanks a bunch. Will try 0.6.
